body:
Hello,
 This config: 
const WHATSAPP_DEVICE = 'Android';                      // The device name.
    const WHATSAPP_VER = '2.10.750';                        // The WhatsApp version.
    const WHATSAPP_TOKEN = "30820332308202f0a00302010202044c.......f918064fd26e30a'; // Token used in request/registration code.
    const WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT = 'WhatsApp/2.10.750 Android/4.2.1 Device/GalaxyS3';//'WhatsApp/2.10.523 WP7/7.10.8858 Device/HTC-HTC-H0002';  // User agent used in request/registration code.

doesn't seem to work anymore. I am trying to register and get my password using /src/php/exampleRegister.php

Anyone know the new config ?

comment_data.body:
I have the same problem, when trying to do codeRequest().
I tried to modify the WhatsApp version in the WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT constant:
    const WHATSAPP_USER_AGENT = 'WhatsApp/2.11.23 Android/4.2.1 Device/GalaxyS3';

but then i get:
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail
    [reason] => bad_token
)

but i dont know if thats the WHATSAPP_TOKEN constant or the $identity that i pass to the constructor of the WhatsPort class...
WHATSAPP_TOKEN constant is outdated, so code request is broken ATM

I'm working on it, but for now use this instead:
https://github.com/shirioko/WART

The README says i can use Mono. I use GNU/Linux so this is the only option.
But how do i Build the binary, cause there is no Makefile or something like that.
Also there is a 'WhatsAppApi.dll' file within the Resources folder, i bet this one only works with windows, right?

EDIT: Ok, i managed to build it with xbuild. Too easy. Anyway, thank you!

You can just download the precompiled exe and run it
```
mono WART-1.3.1.0.exe
```

Well, thats cool. Didn't know that this works on my Linux machine.
Unfortunately, i always get "Could not request verification code".

I tried to debug the program but i can't debug into the API, since it's provided by the dll file
How could it be possible, that WART is working, but WhatsAPI is not? Do they have any information which you have not?
Who is "they"?
Your secret alter ego @shirioko ....

Okay I see - WART is your project, shirioko. I'm sorry. There are lots of issues / forum posts, so I actually don't know, what the current state is - Is registration working or not? In this issue, I see, that WhatsAPI does not work, whereas WART works which confuses me. I'm asking, because lots of people are asking for a registration fix in my Miranda-plugin and I'm trying to fix it as soon as possible :)

It won't be fixed by updating the hashes if that's what you mean. As explained by Jake here:
https://github.com/tgalal/yowsup/issues/158#issuecomment-23554926

I'm working on a practical solution to get registration working again on WhatsApi, but for now I've only added this (experimental) method in WhatsApiNet. I will push my changes to WhatsApiNet as soon as I have a working solution.

Fixed in https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/commit/1995a68f0e5adad5624a720f2e5a0cd31014fcd3

@ulihecht did you get your Miranda plugin working again? :)

I'm working on it. I need to check my request-code algorithm. For a number +712345678 it produces "/MddBpqPfZFANsG0FLdH8MuMy94=", which is wrong (server returns bad_param/token). Can you tell me the correct token for this imaginary phone number? Then I can test, if my algorithm works correctly without having to send code-requests again and again.

The current code is working perfectly fine.

Also, a token is version specific. So we can't give you the "correct" token if you don't specify a version number.

EDIT:
Derp. Didn't read back to see you meant working on the Miranda plugin. What language is it in? You can use the token generator from either WhatsAPI (PHP) or WhatsApiNet (C#) and port it to your own language
:)

Yes, I ported it to C++, and I want to test it. That's why I asked you, what's the expected output of generateRequestToken('Kazakhstan', '712345678');. My output is "/MddBpqPfZFANsG0FLdH8MuMy94=" which is wrong according WhatsApp servers's response, and therefore I must have done something wrong in my port. If you can give me another phone-number together with generateRequestToken's return value it would also be sufficient. I just want to fix my C++-version of your generateRequestToken()

As said above, which user agent version are you using? Each version generates a different token. Use the one from WhatsApiNet:
https://github.com/perezdidac/WhatsAPINet/blob/master/WhatsAppApi/Settings/WhatsConstants.cs#L60

Token generator:
https://github.com/perezdidac/WhatsAPINet/blob/master/WhatsAppApi/Register/WaToken.cs

The generated token for 712345678 using the above code is 
```
L7p6FgM904qeIYe6Sl+rlkVj23I=
```
```c#
string token = WhatsAppApi.Register.WhatsRegisterV2.GetToken("712345678");
```

EDIT
I can give you Base64 encoded strings of the different variables throughout the token generation process so you can compare them with your own generator, if that's any help :)

The algorithm doesn't depend on the user agent, or did I understand something wrong? Thank you!

EDIT:
umm.. https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/commit/1995a68f0e5adad5624a720f2e5a0cd31014fcd3 this is, what I ported, but WaToken.cs seems to have different signature and prefix !? Is the revision which closed this issue not up-to-date anymore?

Yes and no. The algorithm does not use the user agent, but each new whatsapp version has a new WaClassesMd5 string in WaToken.cs (which is the MD5 hash of classes.dex in the APK)
So each new version will generate a different token. 

If your user agent does not match the strings used in the token generator the server won't be able to validate your token and give you a bad_token error.

Thank you. My algorithm works correctly now. Now I receive 
status: sent, length: 6, method: sms, retry_after: 1805
but no SMS. User Agent: WhatsApp/2.11.139 Android/4.2.1 Device/GalaxyS3

Make sure your request string has all the parameters:
https://github.com/perezdidac/WhatsAPINet/blob/master/WhatsAppApi/Register/WhatsRegisterV2.cs#L49

https://v.whatsapp.net/v2/code?lc=KZ&lg=kk&mcc=401&mnc=008&method=sms&to=712345678&token=QQb0lujFo1ICkCroWT0iJDA+c+w=&cc=7&in=12345678&id={ÌôÓ›p¦Ë=$>Ž

Is that okay? Of course I replaced the number with an imaginary one...
Oh god, hurry up and hex encode that ID!

https://v.whatsapp.net/v2/code?lc=KZ&lg=kk&mcc=401&mnc=008&method=sms&to=712345678&token=QQb0lujFo1ICkCroWT0iJDA+c+w=&cc=7&in=12345678&id=d5a11fe204590c01d2b9e5598f58bdf

still doesn't work...

My bad, I meant URL encode :)

Can you download and try my tool WART 1.6.1.0 (on my GitHub) to see if you receive an SMS with established tools? 
If you receive an SMS after using WART the problem is in your code. If not, the problem lies elsewhere.

In your version, the token is url-encoded, and the id is a sha1 hex-string of the reversed number. So this should work:
https://v.whatsapp.net/v2/code?lc=KZ&lg=kk&mcc=401&mnc=008&method=sms&to=712345678&token=QQb0lujFo1ICkCroWT0iJDA%2Bc%2Bw%3D&cc=7&in=12345678&id=a7d579ba76398070eae654c30ff153a4c273272a

the problem is, that I cannot test anymore as I have to wait for hours (retry_after - whatever unit that is, seconds? minutes?) and each time I'm doing it wrong again, they multiply retry_after by factor 10 :(

what is the expected server response? Maybe you can tell me the URL WART generates. They should be equal (except order of get-params), as token and id generating algorithms are equal. Since https is used, I cannot use WireShark to intercept WART's http request.

EDIT: "What is the expected server response" is the most important question here ;)

"Retry after" is in seconds
You can always switch method to voice to check your request, as sms and voice use separate timeouts ;)

I'll cook up a debug version of WART when I get home.
You could use Fiddler to sniff https traffic, though I've implemented the certificate signature check used by WhatsApp  (the dick-move-check™ as I like to call it) which means that the certificate signature is checked using a hard-coded hash, so the certificate cannot be spoofed by Fiddler. Bleh.

For now you can try requesting an SMS code for my dev number 316 474 85 673
I'll let you know if I get anything ;)

Dick-move-check (tm)

FTFY.

:smile: 

EDIT shirioko:
Fixed :wink:

Thank you :)

!!!! EDIT: "What is the expected server response" is the most important question here ;) !!!

EDIT:
My URI seems to be correct. I debugged WART and the parameteres are equal. But WART has the same problem. Probably they changed something again :/
I've uploaded WART 1.6.2.0 which uses the latest User Agent and has debug output option for code request. Can you give it a try to see if that helps?

hi, im working on this whatsapi from the past one month. its working good for my mobile number.but recently when im trying to register a new number with this api im getting an error registration message like this:

Array
(
    [cc] => 91
    [in] => 9703636721
    [id] => %ea%03-%fe%fdp%98%be%a1%7b%27m%c0%2c9%18%27ef%e0
    [code] => ******
    [c] => cookie
)
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail
    [reason] => mismatch
    [retry_after] => 2
)
PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'An error occurred registering the registration code from WhatsApp.' in /var/www/whatsapp1/WhatsAPI/src/php/whatsprot.class.php:233
Stack trace:
#0 /var/www/whatsapp1/WhatsAPI/tests/listen.php(9): WhatsProt->codeRegister('******')
#1 {main}
  thrown in /var/www/whatsapp1/WhatsAPI/src/php/whatsprot.class.php on line 233

i have recently updated the USER_AGENT_TOKEN, and WHATSAPP_VER also,eventhough im getting the same error message. can anyone please help me with this?

[reason] => mismatch

Same issue here.

That is when you put a wrong code, if you receive xxx-xxx

You should do it:

```php
$w->codeRegister('xxxxxx');
```
Wow really? Ehm no. The code I entered is correct, entered it without the hypen.

Btw if you leave the hypen in it you receive a different error:

[reason] => bad_param [param] => code )

Then  the identity or the number is different. When you are doing codeRequest you have data and in codeRegister you have a different data.

That's why the mismatch error.


Also, make sure you are typing the right code.
Unfortunately no... The code always worked fine for me...
If you want, contact me via mail. And ill see whats happening, right?
i have also a same mismatch problem

this mismatch thing is due to the token,i think whatsapp has changed it,so
better use WART where u can directly sniff the password...

title: New version, user agent, token
